text: Say I have a function with signature `f(::Vector{Tuple{Vector{Int},Int}})`  (a vector of pairs) that calls itself recursively (each call induces more than one self-call). Now, for each pair `(Vec,Int)` in my list, the subsequent calls don't modify the vector, only the integer. Would it be better performance-wise to unzip the list of pairs into a pair of list, so that julia knows directly that one of the argument won't be mutated?
